What is that supposed to mean?
It's nothing. Olivia crumples the post-it and turns to Stan.
(re. Zoe's pregnant belly) I had no idea it was that serious.
I told you it was serious.
(interrupting) What the hell does, "sorry about last night" mean?
It's stupid. I was drunk and...
It was nothing.
What was nothing? Olivia turns back to Stan, flabbergasted.
You're having a baby? I didn't know you'd been together that long.
Well, they're not mine...but, yeah, we're having a baby. Two actually. On Zoe's look of shock we...
The fruits and vegetables and flowers become a blur as Zo runs out of the Farmer's Market. Stan chases after her.
sense_profile: The fruits and vegetables and flowers

text: Nothing happened.
Get away from me. Stan runs in front of her, forcing her to stop.
Nothing happened!
You said, "they're not mine."
I didn't mean to say it.
How could you say that?
I don't know. I was flustered.
Flustered?
I'm sorry, I'm not exactly thinking straight. I've been up all night watching Orca give birth!
(incredulous) "They're not mine?"
(at a loss ) Well, I mean...technically, they're not.
The minute he says this, he wishes he could take it back. Zoe just looks at him. She shakes her head.
You know, all this time you're trying to figure out who the real me is, but who the fuck are you?
Zoe. She runs to a nearby cab and slams the door.
Zoe enters the apartment and slams the door behind her. S runs to the couch and collapses in tears. Nuts wheels ove and stands beside her.
Zoe and Mona are at their usual table.    Zoe looks like hasn't slept.
Do you really think something happened with the berry girl?    They both said nothing happened.
Well, are they going to come out and tell me? And that's not even the point. He said, the babies weren't his. And if he says that, he thinks that. And if he thinks that, he's not really committed.
So, now you run?
Why should I stick around for the end of the story when I know what it's going to be? Mona says nothing.   She looks like she might say somethi and then doesn't.
What? If you want to say something, say it.
Do you know the end of the story? Can't you just give him the benefit of the doubt? He seems like such a good guy.
You haven't even met him.

Yeah, and don't think I don't know the reason for that. You were never going to see this through, Zoe. Never. It was doomed before it began. Just like all of your relationships. You get out before you get hurt.
You don't think I'm hurt right now?
Every man is not your father. When are you going to realize that?
You don't know what you're talking about.
I've known you for thirty years. I know you don't trust people. You and your grandmother, both. She's been engaged to Arthur for how long now?
Leave Nana out of this.

She's never going to marry him. Just like you'd never marry Stan. No wonder you ended up with a sperm donor. He'll never let you down. It's your ideal boyfriend. Zoe's face changes.    She looks incredibly hurt.
I used a donor because I wanted a baby.
I'm sorry.     I went too far.

Because I wanted to have a family. Because Nana is the only one I've got and she's eighty-four years old. And then it will just be me. So, yeah, you went a little too far. Zoe leaves Mona at the table.
Zoe and Nuts lie on the pillow together.    Zoe scratches behind his ears.
Guess it's just you and me again. Nuts licks her face. She gets out of bed and goes to chec her belly in the mirror. It's actually getting kind of hu
Zoe walks down the steps. Stan is waiting for her on the sidewalk. His hands in his pockets.
What.
It's Thursday. We have a doctor's appointment.
There is no "we", Stan.
Come on, I didn't mean to say it, and that's not how I feel. Zoe shakes her head.
I made a mistake trusting you.
Don't say that.     That's not true.
You're not good for me. You made me think I needed you, and I don't.
So that's it? Because of one stupid, asinine thing that I said, it's all over? This is how it ends?
Yes.  This is how it ends. (then) I don't know why you're so surprised. I told you, nothing lasts forever. Zoe gives him a matter-of-fact shrug and walks off.
Dr. Harris moves the ultrasound wand over Zoe's belly. holds up her shirt and watches the monitor.
Things look great.
Good.
So, I'll see you back in two weeks, and we'll start checking to see if the babies are dropping.
It's hard to believe we're in the home stretch. Dr. Harris helps Zoe sit up.
Now's the time I start discussing a birthing plan with my patients. Do you want me to wait until next time when Stan's here?
Oh.    Uh, no. He won't be here.
He's out of town or something?
No.    He's just...out.
Oh.   I'm sorry to hear that.
It's back to just you and me now. We've come full circle.
Well, don't you want anyone with you in the delivery room? You know, like a birthing partner?
Zoe and Nana are speed-walking.    Nana stops, excited.
Me?
Yeah.   Is that okay?
Of course.
Good.   `Cause you're all I've got.
What do I have to do?
I don't know. It will be a c-section, so, basically, just stand there and try not to faint.
I can do that.
Thanks, Nana. It means a lot to me that you'll be there.
Are you kidding me? I've been waiting my whole life for this. They pass Arthur, who is in his usual spot, but instead o leering at Nana, he's in his chair with his head back and eyes closed.
Holy shit, is he dead?
Sleeping.
How can you tell?
He's been like that all morning.    I wore him out last night.
Wow.   I did not need to know that.
We were celebrating. (with a smile) We finally set a date. Zoe stops dead in her tracks.
Excuse me?
Nana walks Zoe through the Shadybrook dining room.
So, we'll put the band here and the dance floor right here.
I can't believe you're getting married. What made you change your mind?
All of a sudden it just hit me, what am I waiting for? I love him. He loves me. What am I so afraid of?
Wow.   This is...really big news.
You don't seem happy.
No, I am. It's just...it just makes my situation seem all the more tragic. You're getting married and here I am...
Her voice trails off.
Zoe.
Don't worry. I'm fine.    I'm really happy for you.
I'm worried about you, honey.
I'm fine.
I just don't want you to make the same mistakes I made. I've been alone for over thirty years now, and that's too long. Sometimes in life you have to forgive and move on.
Are you talking about my father or Stan?
Both, baby.
Zoe has her box of photographs.   She pulls out a picture the very bottom.

Because if you don't learn how to forgive, you will always be stuck in the past. The photo is Zoe at age four and a man who looks so much her, that it can only be her father. After a long beat, she puts it on her bedside table, next the one of her mother. The two pictures, side-by-side mak up a family. Zoe and her father in one shot and her mothe from the hospital bed giving the thumbs up sign in the ot Over this image, we hear a quartet playing WEDDING MUSIC.

The music takes us into the church and there we find Nana lovely in her wedding gown, and Arthur, dashing in his morning suit, standing at the alter holding hands. Both h tears in their eyes. Arthur lifts her veil and gives her sweetest kiss. ANGLE ON Zoe and Bobby in the first pew, passing a handkerchief back and forth.
Bobby leans against the piano singing a beautiful renditi of "What a Wonderful World." Nana and Arthur are alone on the dance floor.   It's thei first dance as husband and wife.
(singing) I see trees of green, red roses too. I see them bloom for me and you... Zoe watches, her hands on her belly.   Mona stands beside
This song always makes me cry.
Me, too.
Is it happy or sad? The words are happy but the song is so sad.
I guess it's both.   Happy and sad.
(singing) I see skies of blue and clouds of white. The bright blessed day, the dark and sacred night...
I'm sorry about the things I said.
I know.
It was really shitty of me.
It was. Especially because you were right. Mona takes Zoe's hand.
(singing) And I think to myself...what a wonderful world...
I don't want to be alone forever, Mona.
Then don't be.
Stan stares off into space. His beard is back.   A CUSTOM surveys the different cheeses on the table.
Is this new? The Zoe?
Yeah. This is the first week it's been out.
Can I have a sample?     What's it like?
It's...very stubborn, overly suspicious and distrustful of men. The customer looks up at Stan.
Huh?
Bobby pulls Zoe onto the dance floor.
Come on, you old maid.
No.
Dance with me. One dance.
Forget it.
Fine. But it doesn't mean that I won't dance with you.

What? Bobby starts dancing. But really dancing. Justin Timberla style. Zoe smiles at the absurdity and then tries to walk away. But Bobby won't let her escape. He blocks her path and keeps dancing. This time turning around and shaking h ass triple-time, like Beyonce.
Haaaaaay.
Go away, you freak. A crowd of old people gather round. They start clapping, thinking this is some kind of young person's dance routin
Smack it, Bitch. Bobby takes Zoe's hand and smacks his ass with it.

You know you love it. Uh-huh. That's right. Smack it. The old people do the same. Trying to learn the hip new dance the kids are doing. Several octogenarian couples smacking each other's asses. While this is happening, a weird look crosses Zoe's face. Bobby jumps up and turns around to face Zoe. But when he lands on the ground, his feet slide out from under him an hits the floor.
What the hell? An OLD MAN in the crowd looks down at the puddle.
Damn it. Not again. (then, checks pants) Nope. Not me. A few other old people look down and check themselves. which point, Zoe looks down and realizes.
I think my water just broke.
The whole retirement community is outside throwing rice a Zoe, Bobby, Mona, Nana and Arthur try to figure out the logistics of the trip to the hospital.
sense_profile: to figure out the logistics of the trip to the hospital
Zoe , Bobby , Mona , Nana and Arthur

text: I'll drive.
You're in labor.   You can't drive.
I'll drive.
You don't have a car or a license. (then, to Bobby) You drive.
We're in Queens. I don't even know what side of the road they drive on here.
Will someone please just drive me to the fucking hospital? All of a sudden, a white ROLLS ROYCE pulls up.   Mona's a wheel. She leans out and waves.
This was my surprise for after the wedding, but let's hit it.
This works. They all pile in.
And then the car pulls off, revealing a sign that says, J MARRIED...FINALLY! "Ensure" cans tied to strings bump alo behind them.
Things are a bit frantic in the car.
Are you okay? Remember to breathe. Breathe in, breathe out, breathe in. Mona looks at Zoe in the rearview and does Lamaze breaths
Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, hee-hee.
(joining in) Hoo-hoo. Hee-hee...
Hoo-hoo.   Hee-hee...
Please stop. It's getting really breathy in here. I'm fine.
What about me? I have amniotic fluid on my Gucci tux. ANGLE on the mini bar, which is fully stocked.
Who needs a drink? Everyone (including Zoe) raises their hands.
Zoe is being wheeled into Labor and Delivery with the gan tow. Bobby still has a glass of champagne in his hand. Na grabs the glass and swigs it.
(whispering) Bobby...
What?
I don't know if I can do this.
What?!
I can't go in with her.
Well, I certainly can't do it.   I don't do vaginas. They look at Arthur, who struggles to keep up with his walker.
Don't look at me. Nana starts to hyperventilate.
Help me, Bobby.
Nana, pull yourself together. This is the biggest moment of Zoe's life, and you can't let her down. I'd slap you right now, but I'm afraid your teeth would fly out.
Zoe is now alone in a room wearing a hospital gown.
Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, hee-hee, hoo-hee. Bobby enters, all sweetness and light.
Hey, girl.     How ya doing?
Okay.
Good. (smiles, then) So, I really don't want you to worry, but Nana just passed out at the nurse's station and is now down in the ER getting stitches.
What???
Everything's under control. Good thing we're at the hospital, right? Zoe jumps out of bed.
Where is she?
Get back in bed. All is well. Arthur's with her. Now, on to bigger and better...who do you want to be your birthing partner? Your choices are me or Mona. Zoe starts to cry.
I know. They're shitty choices. Do you want me to call your scary lesbian friends from your group?
I don't know.
We're going to get through this, okay? You just have to really think about it. Who do you want with you in the delivery room? Zoe wipes her tears.
Who is the one person you want by your side?
Zoe runs down the street with a blanket over her hospital gown.
Taxi!
Zoe jumps in.   The cabbie looks at her in the rearview m
You're not an escaped mental patient, are you?
Kind of.

Zoe runs across 14th street. The blanket flaps behind her like a cape. She looks like a hugely pregnant super-hero. And suddenly, she has to slow down and then stop complete for a contraction. She leans against a parked van to stea herself.
sense_profile: like a hugely pregnant super - hero

text: Ow.   Son of a bitch, that hurts.
Are you okay? Out of the corner of her eye, Zoe sees an enormous strawb on the side of the van. And then next to it, she sees Olivia.
Are you in labor? As soon as the contraction ends...
Fuck off. Zoe takes off again.    Olivia watches her go.
Zoe runs through the market looking for Stan. ANGLE ON Stan's truck, where Stan and Fred are unloading cheese.
Stan! Fred turns around and sees Zoe running. All belly and boo bouncing towards him. Her gown starting falling off.
Whoa. I've had nightmares that started like this.
Stan! Stan turns.
Zoe?
Stan!
Are you okay? Don't run!
I can't help it! She keeps running towards him. He now runs towards her. They finally meet. Zoe is out of breath and can barely ta
Are you all right?
(panting) Great. I'm great.
Why are you in a hospital gown?
I'm in labor.
What?   What the hell are you doing here?
It's you.
What?

Nana's my birthing partner, but she passed out and needed stitches, and Bobby asked me who I most wanted with me, and...it's you. It's only you. (then) I don't want to be alone anymore. I love you. You don't know how much I love you.
Stan doesn't know what to say.   He's literally speechles
More than anything in the world, I love you.
I've been in love with you since the moment you stole my cab. Zoe bends over, holding her stomach.   A contraction.
Hee-hee, hoo-hoo, it was my cab, hee-hee, hoo-hoo. The contraction ends. Zoe can finally smile again.      S laughs and throws his arms around her.
Ow.   Ow.   Ow.
I'm sorry. Oh, I'm sorry. I just love you. I love you so much. (then) Let's get the hell out of here.
Yeah. I think I really need to go to the hospital now. They kiss again. And then pull apart and look at each oth Stan has tears in his eyes.
Let's go have our babies. People clap and cheer as they hurry out of the Farmer's Market. Even Olivia, watching from a distance, can't help but applaud the big moment.
Some fantastic song that makes us want to cry is playing. We are CLOSE on Zoe's face. She is smiling.    She does n look scared. And she does not look alone. WIDEN to reveal Stan by her side.

And we PULL BACK and above the operating table and see Dr Harris performing the C-section. He pulls out the babies by one. We FOLLOW the babies as they get swaddled tight and hande back to Zoe and Stan. Zoe and Stan look at the little girls and then at each ot They are both in tears. Even Dr. Harris can't help but cr

It's night.   Zoe is asleep. She opens her eyes and takes a moment to figure out where is. She turns to the side and finds Stan sleeping next to her, curled up against her in the tiny hospital bed. To the side of the bed are two bassinets.   Each baby sle soundly in a little pink hat. And in the next bed is Nana, asleep with a bandage on her forehead.

Nuts trots/rolls down the sidewalk wearing a sweater that says, "I'M A BIG BROTHER." We TILT up and see Zoe and Stan strolling arm in arm, eac with a Baby Bjorn with a rosy-cheeked baby girl in it. Bo girls have flaming red hair. A woman pushing a stroller passes by.   She smiles at Zoe Stan. They smile back.
sense_profile: Zoe and Stan strolling arm in arm , eac with a Baby Bjorn with a rosy - cheeked baby girl in it

text: Hi.
Hi.
Hi.
They are now at the counter with hot dogs in front of the
Who knew you were such a romantic.
Well, it's the anniversary of our first date. Where else would I take you? (then) Cheers. They clink dogs and each take a bite.
What a year, huh?
Incredible. Wouldn't change a thing. Well, except for the part where you dumped me.
And the part where you dumped me. (to the babies) Girls...Mommy and Daddy were stupid. The babies smile and coo.
(baby-talk) Yes, we were. Yes, we were.
The first time we held hands was in here. It started out as a high- five, but then I strategically turned into a hand-hold.
How do you remember that?
We both agreed that we were totally sick of weddings and hated when people wrote their own vows.
That's right. I remember that.
So...I hope you won't hold it against me.
What?
Nana and Arthur come through the door smiling.    Zoe loo them, confused.
What are you doing here? And then Bobby comes through the door.
Bobby? And then Mona.
What's happening? And Joan and Edward. And Jalisa. And Fred. And Carol, Lor and Sara with Dakota planted on her breast. And a priest. And we...
Zoe and Stan, still wearing the Baby Bjorns, stand face t face in front of the guests and the priest.
sense_profile: face t face in front of the guests and the priest

text: I promise to love you even though you still eat chicken McNuggets in bed. I promise to name cheeses after all of our children no matter how embarrassed they are by it. I promise to always check out your ass when you walk away, and I promise to love you more tomorrow than I do today, which doesn't even seem impossible... And slowly, the sound of Stan's voice fades out and the s of Louis Armstrong's voice fades in... And we watch Zoe's face as she realizes that there are so things that really will last forever.
